text: Henry "Hank" Jones (July 31, 1918 â€“ May 16, 2010) was an American jazz pianist, bandleader, arranger, and composer. Jones recorded more than 60 albums under his own name, and countless others as a sideman. On May 19, 1962, he played piano as actress Marilyn Monroe sang her famous "Happy Birthday, Mr. President" song to then U.S. president John F. Kennedy."Hank Jones: The Man Who Accompanied Marilyn", The Marilyn Monrow Collection Blog, February 4, 2009. He was born in Vicksburg, Mississippi and raised in Pontiac, Michigan. Jones died in Manhattan, New York from an illness, aged 91.Peter Keepnews, "Hank Jones, Versatile Jazz Pianist, Is Dead at 91", New York Times, May 17, 2010. ==References== ==Other websites== * Hank Jones official home page * Category:1918 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pianists Category:American composers Category:People from Vicksburg, Mississippi Category:People from Pontiac, Michigan Category:Musicians from Mississippi Category:Musicians from Michigan
title: Hank Jones
